Currently 34 people are registered with Kim Jacobs (zephyrhill[at]fairpoint.net)

Note: Replace [at] with @ 

This is a great way to become firmly grounded in the Transition movement, and to connect with other people in your region.

Expect to be energized, inspired, motivated and to leave with the organizational tools to engage your own community in addressing the issues of economic crisis, lower energy and changing climate!

The workshop is designed both for people interested in learning about the Transition Movement in greater depth, and for people already creating or involved in a Transition Initiative in their community.

Joining us as a special guest co-instructor is Scott McKeown, Training Coordinator of Transition US.      

 Scott brings the benefit of his great experience in founding the thriving Transition Sebastopol, CA, which now has 12 working groups, and is self-sustaining.  From his many volunteer hours, he can speak directly of both the challenges and the fun of this work and of the surprising, positive and creative responses that have emerged over time from within the community. Perhaps most importantly, he can speak of how it feels to have co-created a living, social model that has unleashed his community in a positive way to address the difficulties facing us all.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Course Overview

This two-day course is an in-depth experiential introduction to Transition for those considering bringing Transition to their community or for existing Transition initiatives who are interested in deepening their understanding of Transition.  It is recommended for local communities wishing to become an internationally-recognized Transition Initiative.

At the Training for Transition course, you will:

  • Explore how the Transition process increases community resilience.
  • Receive tools for community outreach, education and engagement.
  • Learn how to summarize the triple challenge of Peak Oil, climate change, and economic instability in ways that move people to positive action.
  • Understand and know how to work with obstacles that have prevented our communities from recognizing and positively responding to the challenge of energy transition.
  • Experience ways that local social and economic community can be created and strengthened.
  • Learn ways of creating a positive, shared vision for your community’s future.
  • Receive support for becoming a Transition catalyst in your community.
  • Connect with others who are helping your region transition to greater stability and security.
  • Become a part of a rapidly growing positive, inspirational, global movement!

Curriculum:
The course describes how to catalyze, build and facilitate a successful Transition initiative. It is packed with imaginative and inspiring ways to engage your community, and delves into both the theory and practice of Transition that has worked so well in hundreds of communities around the world.

Who should attend: 
People interested in learning about the Transition movement in greater depth and leaders already creating a Transition initiative in their community.

Preparation:
Participants are encouraged to prepare as listed below:  
- Reading

  • The Transition Handbook: From Oil Dependency to Local Resilience, by Rob Hopkins
  • "Transition Primer" (free)

- Viewing

  • Transition Whatcom's Great Unleashing (5 min)
  • In Transition (50 min)

Trainers:   Alastair Lough  Scott McKeown

------------------------------------------------------

Tuition, Scholarships

This course is being offered at tuition levels significantly below the national average by volunteer efforts intended to strengthen the Transition Movement in Maine.

Full tuition is $150. Limited scholarships are available for partial or full tuition.  Please contact Kim by email to apply.  We want everyone with a sincere interest to attend at a level they can afford.  No one will be turned away! A $50 deposit is requested.  Remainder due at event.
